title: Examples for walks, trails and paths

blocks.name: 0ewlk
blocks.content: The empty set (empty sequence of edges) is an s-walk of edges for all s. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: 0wlkonlem1
blocks.content: Lemma 1 for ~ 0wlkon and ~ 0trlon . (Contributed by AV, 3-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 23-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: 0cycl
blocks.content: A pair of an empty set (of edges) and a second set (of vertices) is a cycle if and only if the second set contains exactly one vertex (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: upgr1pthd
blocks.content: In a pseudograph with two vertices and an edge connecting these two vertices, to go from one vertex to the other vertex via this edge is a path. The two vertices need not be distinct (in the case of a loop) - in this case, however, the path is not a simple path. (Contributed by AV, 22-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm upgr1pthd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(cvtx, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfv(cvtx, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c1), c5), cpr(c3, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cupgr))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2)), wi(w0, wcel(c1, cupgr)))
  1pthd(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, cfv(cvtx, c1), cfv(ciedg, c1), w0)
  upgr1wlkdlem1(c3, c4, c1, c5, c2, c0, w0)
  upgr1wlkdlem2(c3, c4, c1, c5, c2, c0, w0)
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c1))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c1))
}

blocks.name: upgr1pthond
blocks.content: In a pseudograph with two vertices and an edge connecting these two vertices, to go from one vertex to the other vertex via this edge is a path from one of these vertices to the other vertex. The two vertices need not be distinct (in the case of a loop) - in this case, however, the path is not a simple path. (Contributed by AV, 22-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm upgr1pthond(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c4, cs2(c1, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, cs1(c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(cvtx, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(cvtx, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c2), c5), cpr(c1, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cupgr))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cpthson, c2), c3), c4)), wi(w0, wcel(c2, cupgr)))
  1pthond(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, cfv(cvtx, c2), cfv(ciedg, c2), w0)
  upgr1wlkdlem1(c1, c3, c2, c5, c4, c0, w0)
  upgr1wlkdlem2(c1, c3, c2, c5, c4, c0, w0)
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c2))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c2))
}

blocks.name: lppthon
blocks.content: A loop (which is an edge at index ` J ` ) induces a path of length 1 from a vertex to itself in a hypergraph. (Contributed by AV, 1-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm lppthon(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, cdm(c2)), wceq(cfv(c2, c1), csn(c3))), wbr(cs1(c1), co(c3, cfv(cpthson, c0), c3), cs2(c3, c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c0))
} = {
  1pthond(cs1(c1), c3, c0, c3, cs2(c3, c3), c1, cfv(cvtx, c0), c2, w3a(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, cdm(c2)), wceq(cfv(c2, c1), csn(c3))))
  eqid(cs2(c3, c3))
  eqid(cs1(c1))
  lpvtx(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  simpl3(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, cdm(c2)), wceq(cfv(c2, c1), csn(c3)), wceq(c3, c3))
  adantl(w3a(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, cdm(c2)), wceq(cfv(c2, c1), csn(c3))), wne(c3, c3), wss(cpr(c3, c3), cfv(c2, c1)))
  ax-mp(wi(wne(c3, c3), wss(cpr(c3, c3), cfv(c2, c1))), wceq(c3, c3))
  eqid(c3)
  eqneqall(c3, c3, wss(cpr(c3, c3), cfv(c2, c1)))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm lppthon(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà UHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà dom(c2)‚àß(c2 ` c1)= { c3 })‚Üí <" c1 ">[(c3[(PathsOn ` c0)]c3)]<" c3 . c3 ">)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(iEdg ` c0)
} = {
  1pthond(<" c1 ">, c3, c0, c3, <" c3 . c3 ">, c1, (Vtx ` c0), c2, (c0 ‚àà UHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà dom(c2)‚àß(c2 ` c1)= { c3 }))

  eqid(<" c1 ">)
  lpvtx(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  simpl3(c0 ‚àà UHGraph, c1 ‚àà dom(c2), (c2 ` c1)= { c3 }, c3 = c3)
  adantl((c0 ‚àà UHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà dom(c2)‚àß(c2 ` c1)= { c3 }), c3 ‚â† c3, { c3, c3 } ‚äÜ(c2 ` c1))
  ax-mp((c3 ‚â† c3 ‚Üí { c3, c3 } ‚äÜ(c2 ` c1)), c3 = c3)
  eqid(c3)
  eqneqall(c3, c3, { c3, c3 } ‚äÜ(c2 ` c1))
  eqid((Vtx ` c0))
}

blocks.content: A loop (which is an edge at index ` J ` ) induces a cycle of length 1 in a hypergraph. (Contributed by AV, 2-Feb-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, cdm(c2)), wceq(cfv(c2, c1), csn(c3))), wceq(cfv(cs2(c3, c3), nat0), cfv(cs2(c3, c3), cfv(chash, cs1(c1)))), wcel(c3, cfv(cvtx, c0)))
  lpvtx(c0, c1, c2, c3)

  s2fv1(c3, cfv(cvtx, c0), c3)

blocks.name: wlk2v2e
blocks.content: In a graph with two vertices and one edge connecting these two vertices, to go from one vertex to the other and back to the first vertex via the same/only edge is a walk. Notice that ` G ` is a simple graph (without loops) only if ` X =/= Y ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 8-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrl2v2e
blocks.content: A walk which is not a trail: In a graph with two vertices and one edge connecting these two vertices, to go from one vertex to the other and back to the first vertex via the same/only edge is a walk, see ~ wlk2v2e , but not a trail. Notice that ` G ` is a simple graph (without loops) only if ` X =/= Y ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 8-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm ntrl2v2e(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  -| wcel(c5, universe)
  -| wceq(c2, cs3(c4, c5, c4))
  -| wceq(c1, cop(cpr(c4, c5), c3))
} = {
  a1ii(wn(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2)), wceq(c3, cs1(cpr(c4, c5))))
  a1ii(wn(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2)), wcel(c4, universe))

  mtbir(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c0))))
  intnan(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c0)))
  simpri(wn(wfun(ccnv(c0))), wfun(c0))
  mp2an(wa(wfun(c0), wn(wfun(ccnv(c0)))), w3a(wcel(nat0, cz), wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(nat0, cz)), wne(nat0, nat1))
  3pm3.2i(wcel(nat0, cz), wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(nat0, cz))
  1z()
  0ne1()
  fpropnf1(nat0, cz, nat1, cz, nat0, cz, c0)
  eqtri(c0, cpr(cop(nat0, nat0), cop(nat1, nat0)), cs2(nat0, nat0))

thm uhgr3cyclexlem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8) {
  ‚ä¢ ((((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚àß c0 ‚â† c2)‚àß((c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3))‚àß(c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))))‚Üí c3 ‚â† c6)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Vtx ` c7)
  ‚ä£ c8 =(Edg ` c7)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(iEdg ` c7)
} = {
  a1ii(((((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚àß c0 ‚â† c2)‚àß((c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3))‚àß(c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))))‚Üí c3 ‚â† c6), c1 =(Vtx ` c7))
  a1ii(((((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚àß c0 ‚â† c2)‚àß((c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3))‚àß(c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))))‚Üí c3 ‚â† c6), c8 =(Edg ` c7))
  a1ii(((((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚àß c0 ‚â† c2)‚àß((c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3))‚àß(c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))))‚Üí c3 ‚â† c6), c4 =(iEdg ` c7))
  imp(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚àß c0 ‚â† c2), ((c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3))‚àß(c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))), c3 ‚â† c6)
  impancom((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1), c0 ‚â† c2, ((c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3))‚àß(c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))), c3 ‚â† c6)
  necon3d(c0, c2, c3, c6, ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚àß((c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3))‚àß(c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6)))))
  imp32((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1), (c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3)), (c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6)), (c3 = c6 ‚Üí c0 = c2))
  com14((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1), (c3 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3)), (c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6)), c3 = c6, c0 = c2)
  adantld(c3 = c6, c3 ‚àà dom(c4), { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3), ((c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))‚Üí((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c0 = c2)))
  syl6bi(c3 = c6, { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c3), ((c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6))‚Üí((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c0 = c2)), { c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c6))
  eqeq2d({ c2, c5 }, (c4 ` c3), (c4 ` c6), c3 = c6)
  fveq2(c3, c6, c4)
  com12({ c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c6), (c6 ‚àà dom(c4)‚àß { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6)), ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c0 = c2))
  adantl(c6 ‚àà dom(c4), { c5, c0 } =(c4 ` c6), ({ c2, c5 } =(c4 ` c6)‚Üí((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c0 = c2)))

  eqeq2((c4 ` c6), { c5, c0 }, { c2, c5 })
  eqcoms({ c2, c5 }, { c5, c0 }, ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c0 = c2))
  sylbi({ c5, c0 } = { c2, c5 }, ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c0 = c2), { c0, c5 } = { c2, c5 })

blocks.name: uhgr3cyclex
blocks.content: If there are three different vertices in a hypergraph which are mutually connected by edges, there is a 3-cycle in the graph containing one of these vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 12-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: umgr3cyclex
blocks.content: If there are three (different) vertices in a multigraph which are mutually connected by edges, there is a 3-cycle in the graph containing one of these vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 12-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm umgr3cyclex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cumgr), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), w3a(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5))), wex(s0, wex(s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ccycls, c0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), nat3), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), c1)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cedg, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  syl121anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cumgr), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), w3a(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5))), wex(s0, wex(s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ccycls, c0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), nat3), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), c1)))), wcel(c0, cuhgr), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), w3a(wne(c1, c3), wne(c1, c4), wne(c3, c4)), w3a(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5)))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cumgr), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), w3a(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5)), wcel(c0, cuhgr))
  umgruhgr(c0)
  simp2(wcel(c0, cumgr), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), w3a(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cumgr), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), w3a(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5)), w3a(wne(c1, c3), wne(c1, c4), wne(c3, c4)))
  3jca(wa(wcel(c0, cumgr), w3a(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5))), wne(c1, c3), wne(c1, c4), wne(c3, c4))

  3ad2ant3(wcel(cpr(c1, c3), c5), wcel(cpr(c3, c4), c5), wcel(cpr(c4, c1), c5), wcel(cpr(c1, c4), c5))

  eleq1i(cpr(c4, c1), c5, cpr(c1, c4))

  umgredgne(c0, c1, c4, c5)

blocks.name: upgr4cycl4dv4e
blocks.content: If there is a cycle of length 4 in a pseudograph, there are four (different) vertices in the graph which are mutually connected by edges. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 9-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 13-Feb-2021.)
